value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TEIdI5bFCSU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:

value.title: Power BI query reduction when using DirectQuery
value.excerpt: Using DirectQuery in Power BI? Things slowing down and you want to make interactions snappier? Patrick looks how you can change a few settings to take the experience within Power BI to the next level!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1
